greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k triple descents (n>=0,0<=k<=n-3). We say that i is a triple descent of a permutation p if p(i) > p(i+1) > p(i+2) > p(i+3).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..143, flattened
P. Flajolet and R. Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, 2009; see page 210
formula: E.g.f.: 1/(1 - x - Sum_{k,n} I(n,k)(y - 1)^k*x^n/n!) where I(n,k) is the coefficient of y^k*x^n in the ordinary generating function expansion of y x^4/(1 - y*x - y*x^2 - y*x^3) See Flajolet and Sedgewick reference in Links section.
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(u+o=0, 1, expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0, 1)):
mathematica: nn=10; u=y-1; a=Apply[Plus, Table[Normal[Series[y x^4/(1-y x - y x^2-y x^3), {x,0,nn}]][[n]]/(n+3)!, {n,1,nn-3}]]/.y->u; Range[0,nn]! CoefficientList[Series[1/(1-x-a), {x,0,nn}], {x,y}]//Grid
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 12 2012
